logic

Class EnvironmentController

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.EnvironmentController

  • public class EnvironmentController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the controller of the game's Environment. It manages all the information about the environment.

    This class manages all the information of the game's Environment. It controls the EnvironmentView and all the information shown in it. This class also contains and manages the information about the teams, the ball and the final score.

    Version:
    v0.1 04/30/2014
    Author:
    Eduard de Torres

        public Coordinates[] getTeamCoordenates(boolean team_a)
        Returns a Coordinates's array with the information about the position of the selected's team's players in the environment's grid world.
        Parameters:
        team_a - if true, the selected team will be team A.
        Returns:
        a Coordinates's array with the positions of the selected's team's players.

      • assignSocket

        public int assignSocket(java.net.Socket socket,
               boolean team_A,
               java.lang.String name)
        Finds an empty socket slot to assign a new player connection to it.

        Assigns the given socket and name to an empty socket space of the given team. The method returns the player's number of the team. If there weren't any empty socket space in the given team, the method returns -1;

        Parameters:
        socket - the socket to assign to the player.
        team_A - the player's team. If true, team A will be selected.
        name - the name of the player.
        Returns:
        the number of the player's team or -1 if the team was full.

      • disconnectSocket

        public void disconnectSocket(boolean team_A,
                    int position)
        Disconnects a socket and cleans the data to represent a free socket slot.

        Disconnects the Socket of the given player from the given team and sets if as an empty space.

        Parameters:
        team_A - the team of the selected player. If true, team A will be selected.
        position - the number of the player inside its team.

      • updateInfo

        public void updateInfo(java.lang.String team_a_name,
              java.lang.String team_b_name,
              boolean goalkeeper_a,
              boolean goalkeeper_b,
              java.lang.String number_players_a,
              java.lang.String number_players_b,
              int color_a,
              int color_b)
        Updates all the information contained in this class.
        Parameters:
        team_a_name - the name of the team A.
        team_b_name - the name of the team B.
        goalkeeper_a - true if the team A has a goalkeeper.
        goalkeeper_b - true if the team B has a goalkeeper.
        number_players_a - number of "active" players (non dummies) in team A.
        number_players_b - number of "active" players (non dummies) in team B.
        color_a - color of the team A.
        color_b - color of the team B.

      • checkTeams

        public boolean checkTeams(int num_players_A,
                 int num_players_B)
        Returns if there is any "empty player" in the game.

        Returns if there is any player of either team that is "empty" which means that there isn't any client controlling it's movements.

        Parameters:
        num_players_A - number of players in team A.
        num_players_B - number of players in team B.
        Returns:
        true if there is any "empty player" in the game.

      • prepareInfo

        public java.lang.String prepareInfo(boolean team_a)
        Parses the information about the game's environment and creates a encoded string with all the information.

        Creates an encoded string with the information of all the players in the game's environment and the ball. This encoded string is constructed as follows: - If any player is not configured (the number of players in a team is <5) it's coordinates are (-1, -1). - Any player, goalkeeper or ball coordinate will be represented as a string like "x-coordinate y-coordinate" (e.g. "3 15"). - After any player, goalkeeper or ball coordinate the string will contain a "/". - The goalkeepers, players and ball coordinates will be ordered as follows: + GM - Goalkeeper from my team + GO - Goalkeeper from the rival team + P#M - Player number # from my team + P#O - Player number # from the rival team + B - Ball String = "GM/P1M/P2m/P3M/P4M/GO/P1O/P2O/P3O/P4O/B"

        Parameters:
        team_a - team that is "my team". If true, my team will be team A.
        Returns:
        an encoded string with the information of all the players in the game's environment and the ball.

      • getWhoHaveBall

        public java.lang.String getWhoHaveBall(boolean team_a)
        Returns an encoded string indicating who has the ball.

        Returns an encoded string indicating who has the ball. The encoding method has the format "T/N", where T can be {M, O} depending on which team has possession of the ball (M for my team, O for rival team), and N represents the player's number in possession of the ball [-1..TEAM_SIZE] starting with -1 representing the goalkeeper. If noone has the ball, the method will return "NONE".

        Parameters:
        team_a - team that is "my team". If true, my team will be team A.
        Returns:
        an encoded string indicating who has the ball.

      • haveBall

        public boolean haveBall(Coordinates player)
        Returns if the given player has the ball.

        Returns if a player with the given coordinates would be in possession of the ball.

        Parameters:
        player - coordinates of the player to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given player would be in possession of the ball.

      • checkCatchBall

        public boolean checkCatchBall(Coordinates player,
                     Coordinates ball)
        Returns if a given player would be in possession of a given ball.

        Returns if a player with the given coordinates would be in possession of a ball with the given coordinates.

        Parameters:
        player - coordinates of the given player.
        ball - coordinates of the given ball.
        Returns:
        true if the given player would be in possession of the given ball.

      • movePlayer

        public Coordinates movePlayer(boolean team_a,
                     int number,
                     Coordinates coords)
        Returns the Coordinates of a given player in a given team after moving towards a given Coordinates.

        Returns the Coordinates of a player after trying to move the player towards a given Coordinates. If the given team number is -1, the moving player will be the goalkeeper. The player will move from the actual bloc in the grid world to the contiguous bloc that is closer to the destination.

        Parameters:
        team_a - the player's team. If true, the team is team A.
        number - the players number inside its team.
        coords - the destination of the movement.
        Returns:
        te Coordinates of the contiguous bloc that is closer to the destination.

      • checkValidPosition

        public boolean checkValidPosition(boolean team_a,
                         int number,
                         Coordinates position)
        Returns whether a given players runs into any other player in the field.

        Returns whether the chosen player of either team runs into one of their teammates, against any of its rivals or is outside the game's field's boundaries.

        Parameters:
        team_a - the player's team. If true, the team is team A.
        number - the players number inside its team.
        position - Coordinates to check where the player would be.
        Returns:
        false if the player runs into any other player.

      • init_goal

        public void init_goal(boolean team_a)
        Configures all the Environment and server status to a scored goal status.

        This method must be called when a goal is scored. It configures the environment and the server to identify a that a goal has been scored.

        Parameters:
        team_a - sets which team has scored the goal. True if team A has scored a goal.

      • init_out

        public void init_out()
        Configures all the Environment and server status to a ball outside the field's boundaries status.

        This method must be called when the ball moves outside the game field's boundaries. It configures the environment and the server to identify that the ball has gone outside the field's boundaries.

      • manage_goal

        public void manage_goal(boolean team_a)
        Manages a goal scoring event.

        This method manages all the configurations and action that needs to be done when either team scores a goal. After scoring a goal, the application must stop the player's actions, reset the ball's and player's positions in the field and restart the game.

        Parameters:
        team_a - sets which team has scored the goal. True if team A has scored a goal.

      • resizePanel

        public void resizePanel()
        Resizes the panel.

        This method will be called when the main frame changes it's size. This method must implement all the necessary operations to adapt it's elements to the new size of the panel.

      • changeLanguage

        public void changeLanguage()
        Changes the language of the panel.

        This method will be called when the main frame changes it's language. This method must implement all the necessary operations to change the language of all the dialogs contained in the panel.

      • changeColors

        public void changeColors()
        Changes the color's mode of the panel between normal and color blind mode.

        This method will be called when the main frame changes it's color mode. This method must implement all the necessary operations to adapt it's element's colors to the new color mode.
